alert.note: Alert for Codington (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:47AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River at Watertown Broadway Avenue affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River at Watertown Sioux Conifer Road affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Near Watertown affecting Codington County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River Above Lake Kampeska affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Near Florence affecting Grant County. Willow Creek near Watertown affecting Codington County. Mud Creek near Rauville affecting Codington County. South Branch Tributary Mud Creek near Rauville affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Near Castlewood affecting Hamlin County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River at Watertown Sioux Conifer Road. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Significant amounts of pasture land are flooded. At 12.0 feet, Sioux Conifer Road floods south of the gauge, and water reaches the bottom of the bridge at the gauge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM CDT Wednesday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.1 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening by 745 PM CDT.
